perturbation.original_text:
The Maintenance Fee after the expiry of the Warranty period shall be $20,000 per year, starting from the date after the Warranty period (Contract Year), renewable at the end of each Contract Year.

In the event that during the four consecutive calendar quarters which begin immediately after the start of a Contract Year, LICENSEE completes payments to D2 of one hundred thousand dollars in Runtime License Fees under this Agreement, D2 will apply a credit equaling to 100% of the Maintenance Fee against the Runtime License Fees of that Contract Year.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Maintenance Fee after the expiry of the Warranty period shall be $20,000 per year, starting from the date after the Warranty period (Contract Year), renewable at the end of each Contract Year.

In the event that during the four consecutive calendar quarters which begin immediately after the start of a Contract Year, LICENSEE completes payments to D2 of one hundred thousand dollars in Development License Fees under this Agreement, D2 will apply a credit equaling to 50% of the Maintenance Fee against the Runtime License Fees of that Contract Year.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing 'Runtime License Fees' to 'Development License Fees' and '100%' to '50%'. This creates uncertainty and potential disputes as the conditions under which the Maintenance Fee is credited are now altered, leading to confusion as to which fees apply.

perturbation.original_text: BUYOUT OPTION: Within the Warranty period, LICENSEE may elect to pay D2 a sum of $1,400,000 as a one time paid-up runtime license fees for the Basic Services specified in Exhibit A.
perturbation.changed_text: BUYOUT OPTION: Within two years after the Warranty period, LICENSEE may elect to pay D2 a sum of $700,000 as a one time paid-up development license fees for the Basic Services specified in Exhibit A.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by changing the time to exercise the Buyout option from 'Within the Warranty period' to 'Within two years after the Warranty period', the cost '$1,400,000' to '$700,000' and the buyout license from 'runtime license fees' to 'development license fees'. This introduces uncertainty and potential disputes over the terms of the buyout option and creates an ambiguity regarding which buyout applies.

perturbation.original_text: 5.  LICENSEE's Customer agrees that D2 or LICENSEE retain the entire right and title to Licensed Technology.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  LICENSEE's Customer agrees that D2 retain the entire right and title to Licensed Technology.

6. LICENSEE's Customer agrees that LICENSEE retain the entire right and title to Licensed Technology.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by stating both D2 and LICENSEE retain the entire right and title to the Licensed Technology, which isn't possible. This introduces uncertainty and potential disputes over the ownership of Licensed Technology.
